intro: Graphephorum brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Graphephorum brandegeei is part of the Campanulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
